alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Fairfield, Lexington and Richland. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Irmo is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. At 602 PM, a flooding was reported near Hollingshed Rd in Richland County. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Irmo, St. Andrews, Harbison State Forest, Ballentine, Upper Richland Fire Station, Lake Murray Marina, Seven Oaks, White Rock and Lighthouse Marina. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 94 and 103. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
